page.title: 14ACCOMODATION IN GRANTOWN
page.content:
Grantown-on-Spey has a wide variety of accomodation to suit all types of visitor. Tourism in Grantown grew in the Victorian era and several large hotels were built then for the visitors. These include The Grant Arms, where Queen Victoria stayed, The Palace, The Garth, The Craiglynn and The Strathspey Hotel.
Large houses were also built about this time, many of which are now used as boarding houses or small licensed hotels. During the summer many houses do "Bed and Breakfast" for visitors.
Recently a well appointed camp and caravan site has been completed, with a shop and full facilities. Rented accomodtion is also available and a development of holiday flats has recently been completed.
